a death sentence by hanging issued by a court of law, king, etc. to a person.
a strong rope with a noose prepared specially for hanging criminals.
to kill a person by hanging.
= ನೇಣುಕಾರ್ತಿ.
(myth.) Varuṇa, who holds a noose in his hands.
= ನೇಣ್ಗಯ್ಯ.
= ನೇಣ್ಗಯ್ಯ.
a man who has been hanged to death.
a kind of net, made of cord-network, having nooses to trap wild animals.
= ನೇಣ್ಬಲೆ.
a kind of bow ( a device for shooting arrows).
to be hanging or suspended.
a man who leads others, esp. people at large.
(a term used to mean negation) that which is not; that which is absent; ನೇತಿ ಮಾಡು nēti māḍu = ನೇತಿಗಳೆ - 1.
to remove; to eliminate; to get rid of.
to spend, exhaust, consume or pay out something uselessly.
= ನೇತಾರ.
a master; a lord.
the position of a leader.
the quality or ability of a leader.
the organ of sight; the eye.
a cord tied to a churning stick used to turn churn.
the root of a tree.
a rootlike extension that grows from the branch of a tree (as banian), takes root in the ground and later becomes an additional trunk; an aerial root.
a kind of cloth.
the tree Areca catechu of Arecaceae family; areca tree.
the tree Myristica laurifolia of Myristicaceae family; common wild nutmeg tree.
its hard, seed.
that can be seen; that can be perceived visually.
that which can be perceived visually.
a doctor who treats eye-diseases and eye disorders; an ophthalmologist.
a treating of the eye diseases and disorders.
either of the two movable folds of flesh that cover and uncover the front of the eyeball; an eye-lid.
= ನೇತ್ರವೈದ್ಯ.
= ನೇತ್ರವೈದ್ಯೆ.
Śiva, who has an extra, all-destroying eye on his forehead.
a silk fabric.
a gesture or motion of the eye that conveys a sign, information or gives a command.
